alert.note: Alert for McDonald; Newton (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 8:21AM CDT until July 21 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Newton County in southwestern Missouri... Eastern McDonald County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 900 AM CDT. * At 821 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Shoal Creek Drive to near Neosho to near Anderson, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Southern Joplin, Leawood, Silver Creek and Saginaw around 825 AM CDT. Granby and Diamond around 835 AM CDT. Fairview around 845 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Big Sugar Creek State Park, Loma Linda, Newtonia, Stella, Redings Mill, Wentworth, Stark City, Grand Falls Plaza, Shoal Creek Estates and Ritchey. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 8. Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 35. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
